stem: Given question: He ordered his men to go forth and drive the enemy which way? and answer: backwards, explain why in
no_more_50_words: When one drives away the enemy, the goal is to keep them from advancing forward and claiming more land, instead sending them back the way they came.
100_to_150_words: He ordered his men to go forth and drive the enemy backwards because by doing so, the enemy would be pushed away from the area and out of danger. By pushing the enemy backwards, the attacking forces would have an easier time controlling the situation and keeping the enemy away. Driving the enemy backwards also ensures that the attacking forces are not caught off guard by any sudden counter-moves or advances by the enemy. In addition, driving the enemy backwards would give the attacking forces more time to regroup, as they could easily fall back to their original positions if the enemy attempted to attack. Finally, driving the enemy backwards would also allow the attacking forces to gain an advantageous position, as they would be able to launch a surprise attack on the enemy while they are in retreat.
